test-case.name: format-dateTime-004
test-case.test: for $i in 1 to 24 return format-dateTime($t + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT1H')*$i, '[h].[m]')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-005
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: upper-case roman numerals for year
test-case.test: string-join( for $i in 1 to 100 return format-dateTime($t + xs:yearMonthDuration('P1Y')*$i, '[YI]'), '; ')

result.assert-string-value: MCMLI; MCMLII; MCMLIII; MCMLIV; MCMLV; MCMLVI; MCMLVII; MCMLVIII; MCMLIX; MCMLX; MCMLXI; MCMLXII; MCMLXIII; MCMLXIV; MCMLXV; MCMLXVI; MCMLXVII; MCMLXVIII; MCMLXIX; MCMLXX; MCMLXXI; MCMLXXII; MCMLXXIII; MCMLXXIV; MCMLXXV; MCMLXXVI; MCMLXXVII; MCMLXXVIII; MCMLXXIX; MCMLXXX; MCMLXXXI; MCMLXXXII; MCMLXXXIII; MCMLXXXIV; MCMLXXXV; MCMLXXXVI; MCMLXXXVII; MCMLXXXVIII; MCMLXXXIX; MCMXC; MCMXCI; MCMXCII; MCMXCIII; MCMXCIV; MCMXCV; MCMXCVI; MCMXCVII; MCMXCVIII; MCMXCIX; MM; MMI; MMII; MMIII; MMIV; MMV; MMVI; MMVII; MMVIII; MMIX; MMX; MMXI; MMXII; MMXIII; MMXIV; MMXV; MMXVI; MMXVII; MMXVIII; MMXIX; MMXX; MMXXI; MMXXII; MMXXIII; MMXXIV; MMXXV; MMXXVI; MMXXVII; MMXXVIII; MMXXIX; MMXXX; MMXXXI; MMXXXII; MMXXXIII; MMXXXIV; MMXXXV; MMXXXVI; MMXXXVII; MMXXXVIII; MMXXXIX; MMXL; MMXLI; MMXLII; MMXLIII; MMXLIV; MMXLV; MMXLVI; MMXLVII; MMXLVIII; MMXLIX; MML

test-case.name: format-dateTime-006
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: lower-case roman numerals for year (with the width specifier padded)
test-case.test: string-join( for $i in 1 to 100 return format-dateTime($t + xs:yearMonthDuration('P17Y')*$i, '[Yi,3-3]'), '; ')

result.assert-string-value: dcccxvii; dcccxxxiv; dcccli; dccclxviii; dccclxxxv; cmii; cmxix; cmxxxvi; cmliii; cmlxx; cmlxxxvii; miv; mxxi; mxxxviii; mlv; mlxxii; mlxxxix; mcvi; mcxxiii; mcxl; mclvii; mclxxiv; mcxci; mccviii; mccxxv; mccxlii; mcclix; mcclxxvi; mccxciii; mcccx; mcccxxvii; mcccxliv; mccclxi; mccclxxviii; mcccxcv; mcdxii; mcdxxix; mcdxlvi; mcdlxiii; mcdlxxx; mcdxcvii; mdxiv; mdxxxi; mdxlviii; mdlxv; mdlxxxii; mdxcix; mdcxvi; mdcxxxiii; mdcl; mdclxvii; mdclxxxiv; mdcci; mdccxviii; mdccxxxv; mdcclii; mdcclxix; mdcclxxxvi; mdccciii; mdcccxx; mdcccxxxvii; mdcccliv; mdccclxxi; mdccclxxxviii; mcmv; mcmxxii; mcmxxxix; mcmlvi; mcmlxxiii; mcmxc; mmvii; mmxxiv; mmxli; mmlviii; mmlxxv; mmxcii; mmcix; mmcxxvi; mmcxliii; mmclx; mmclxxvii; mmcxciv; mmccxi; mmccxxviii; mmccxlv; mmcclxii; mmcclxxix; mmccxcvi; mmcccxiii; mmcccxxx; mmcccxlvii; mmccclxiv; mmccclxxxi; mmcccxcviii; mmcdxv; mmcdxxxii; mmcdxlix; mmcdlxvi; mmcdlxxxiii; mmd

test-case.name: format-dateTime-006a
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: lower-case roman numerals for year (with the width specifier padded). Variant of test-case format-dateTime-006

test-case.name: format-dateTime-009
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: test format-dateTime: ISO week numbers Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-010
test-case.description: test format-dateTime: ISO day within week Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-011
test-case.description: Test format-dateTime: ISO week number within month. Specifically, in the ISO calendar the days of the week are numbered from 1 (Monday) to 7 (Sunday), and week 1 in any calendar year is the week (from Monday to Sunday) that includes the first Thursday of that year.

modified.change: See spec bug 21370 and test bug 21794

test-case.name: format-dateTime-012
test-case.description: test format-dateTime(): a,b,c... numbering sequence (not actually useful but allowed by the spec...
test-case.test: for $i in 1 to 60 return format-dateTime($t + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT61S')*$i, '[mA].[sa]')

result.assert-string-value: P.g Q.h R.i S.j T.k U.l V.m W.n X.o Y.p Z.q AA.r AB.s AC.t AD.u AE.v AF.w AG.x AH.y AI.z AJ.aa AK.ab AL.ac AM.ad AN.ae AO.af AP.ag AQ.ah AR.ai AS.aj AT.ak AU.al AV.am AW.an AX.ao AY.ap AZ.aq BA.ar BB.as BC.at BD.au BE.av BF.aw BG.ax 0.ay A.az B.ba C.bb D.bc E.bd F.be G.bf H.bg J.0 K.a L.b M.c N.d O.e P.f

test-case.description: test format-dateTime(): timezones in GMT+x notation

test-case.name: format-dateTime-018
test-case.description: test format-dateTime(): timezones in GMT+x notation

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en142
test-case.test: for $i in 0 to 23 return let $t := $b + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT1H')*$i return translate(format-dateTime($t, '[h]~[m][P]', 'en', (), ()), '.- ', '')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en143
test-case.description: English noon/midnight. The US convention seems to be noon=AM, midnight=PM, and as no-one except the US uses the 12-hour clock these days, we'll go with that.
test-case.test: for $i in 0 to 1 return let $t := $b + xs:dayTimeDuration('PT12H')*$i return translate(format-dateTime($t, '[h]~[m][P]', 'en', (), ()), '.- ', '')

test-case.name: format-dateTime-en151
test-case.description: test format-dateTime: fallback to English for unsupported language. Test assumes (a) that Iberian (xib) is not supported, and (b) that the fallback language is English. Changed from lang="fo" to lang="xib": See bug 862.

test-case.name: format-dateTime-inpt-er2
test-case.description: wrong number of args to format-date()

test-case.name: format-dateTime-inpt-er3
test-case.description: wrong type of args to format-date()

test-case.name: format-dateTime-1340err
test-case.description: Error FOFD1340 syntax of picture is incorrect
